website_summaries.verdict: The Fujifilm Instax Square SQ10 is an instant film camera married with the convenience of a digital camera, but it's not without compromise.
pros: The Fujifilm Instax Square SQ10 uses a new square format that offers larger prints while keeping the camera relatively compact
It's a digital camera letting you shoot and print only the images you want, and you can add filters or a vignette before or after you shoot
cons: Its low-resolution digital photos are mediocre and highlights blow out easily
The camera's controls and menus are unintuitive
There's no wireless connection for sharing or printing with a mobile device

website_summaries.verdict: The Instax Square SQ10 is a new type of instant camera, blending digital capture with true analog film output, but images are difficult to share online.
cons: More expensive than purely analog instant cameras
No way to save filtered digital images

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy to report that Fujifilm has delivered another solid addition ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this camera for my wife, who is new to instant photography. I own an Instax 500AF camera and have been using using Instax Wide film for a couple of years now. After testing this camera for over a week, I'm happy to report that Fujifilm has delivered another solid addition to the Instax family line of cameras...but take note: If you're a fussy and demanding instant photo perfectionist, this is NOT the camera you're looking for. If you're new to the world of instant photography, or are looking for quality instant photographs with modern digital replay convenience, you couldn't do better than the Instax Square camera.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Rice

customer_reviews.title: It may be a hybrid of digital and analog, but if you think of it first as an instant camera, it’s a worthy heir to SX-70.
customer_reviews.text: Too many people have failed to understand that the SQ10 is first and foremost an instant camera with unprecedented creative control. It brings the ability to creatively adjust and edit an instant photo, add digital filters, shoot as close as you’d like, and shoot handheld images in low light without flash. No other instant camera can do what this Instax can. And while the square format Instax pictures are smaller than the resurrected Polaroid format, the results are far more predictable, with better color, contrast, sharpness and consistent exposures, to say nothing of far faster development times, now at about a half the cost of Polaroid’s offerings. It’s a more thoughtful approach to instant photography than just one step.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Phillips

customer_reviews.title: I'm snap happy!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! I love the fact that the photos don't come out washed out looking, which is the one thing that bothers me about instant photos. Since there are many options to adjust/balance a photo, you're least likely to waste film. I also like the fact that you have the option to print instantaneously or print at a later time. I will say that the camera is a little heavy, but it feels slightly lighter than the Wide 300 camera. Lastly, the charging cord could be a little longer, but it's not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely in love with this camera. I've been taking so many pictures with it and I love the fact that you don't need to have film inserted to take photos! My first instant camera was the Instax mini 8 and I used to always waste film trying to capture the perfect picture. I would always be disappointed when it was overexposed or underexposed but now I can edit my photos before and after taking pictures! This camera has many features and I love all of them! I would recommend this camera
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this camera! As someone who adores the old school Polaroid cameras this is the perfect match. It became too costly to keep using my 2003 model and this was the perfect upgrade. I'm able to see the pictures I take before wasting my film, add filters, and I can even print out more than one copy! They also print out almost identical to those of older cameras in the fact that they're wider as compared to other cameras that have skinnier prints. I don't have a single complaint and all my friends want one now too!
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn

customer_reviews.title: Product has many issues and I lucky to get it ...
customer_reviews.text: Product has many issues and I lucky to get it to work. Has been in doors it’s whole life and throws of random over heat codes. Fuji has a very rigorous return process that has made me want to pull my hair out and cut my losses. I’d stick with the mini.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Dodson

customer_reviews.title: Good Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: My son wanted this camera for Christmas. He has really enjoyed making pictures with it. It's not too big for his 11 year old hands. He has learned how to use it all on his own. It is great having the screen to look at pictures so there are no wasted prints since the film is not cheap. The picture quality is not that of a regular camera, but it does make really cute photos to display. You can make a lot of adjustments once you have the picture on the screen with color, light, zooming, etc. Overall, it's a great first camera for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Special looks not saved!
customer_reviews.text: Know that none of settings you work hard to get within the camera itself are not saved. The images you download are plain & boring and nothing like the actual print or what you saw on screen.
customer_reviews.author: so cal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because of its double exposure function. I bought the SQ6 first, and while I enjoy the SQ6 capabilities, I don't like wasting film. The SQ10 solves the issue as it's hybrid of an analog and digital. I enjoy being able to share prints of my creations and hone my skills taking double exposures. I've included some of the pictures I've been able to take. I also like the fact that the battery is rechargeable and the camera as a whole isn't terribly heavy. I only wish it was easier to find cute accessories!
customer_reviews.author: S. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Extreme disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Turned the product on and it came up with a white screen. No manual included in the box for troubleshooting. Camera is defective and now I get to pay for return shipping to try and get some of my expenses back toward an extremely disappointing Christmas morning.
customer_reviews.author: Trina Rizuto

customer_reviews.title: Great features
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend wanted a polaroid for her birthday, and after lots of searching I settled on the SQ10 hybrid and she couldn't have been happier. The picture quality is great and she loves that she can save the pictures still on an SD card. She also loves adding filters before printing them. Overall great product I do recommend buying a case for it, I bought one at the same time as I bought the camera for her. She has taken this camera around the world since and it still looks brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Kane Davis

customer_reviews.title: this is great. You can save photos and choose which ones ...
customer_reviews.text: For a polaroid camera, this is great. You can save photos and choose which ones to print. The quality of the printed photos is good compared to other polaroid cameras where it's either too bright or dark. Of course don't expect it to have all the specs of a digital camera because this is an instant cam.
customer_reviews.author: GxR915.Wolf

customer_reviews.title: If you can, go with the SQ20
customer_reviews.text: For the price difference I would recommend the SQ20. It’s an updated version with a lot of enhancements or improvements. If budget is an issue then defiantly get this. Blends digitally and analog beautifully. Instant photos and a mini-SD card for digital copies. The quality of the digital isn’t the best though. Uses square fujifilm. Durable. Rechargeable. Fujifilm has the best tones and colors out of an instant camera system. Multiple flash options. Can do double exposures and collages. Can edit in camera then print.
customer_reviews.author: @shawnroller

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera. It's the best of both worlds in digital and instant photography.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is perfect for the average person or amateur photographer. It takes great pictures, overall. I do wish the picture quality was a little bit better. Even using the flash and getting a crisp shot, the printout has a "soft" look to it, almost like it's blurry. It could be the film but I'm not really sure. Love this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Jadrich

customer_reviews.title: Already having a lot of fun with this!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this lil thing and even though it is expensive film it is a delight for those who want instant photo gratification or little pics to send to friends! My only caution is that the photos print out darker than they appear on the viewfinder so make sure you spend time learning the settings and how to adjust the image accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: ConsciousConsuma

customer_reviews.title: Nice Vintage Style Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is really good. I was skeptical at first but it does take some really great shots. Remember there always must be bright lighting for the images to turn out as expected. You can use the flash but I wouldn't recommend a lot of low light photography.
customer_reviews.author: Andy V

customer_reviews.title: Wedding Gift
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect wedding gift. It worked great out of the box and was easy to use. It was a weeding gift accompanied with a couple of packs of film so the newly weds had candid photos on their way home from the reception.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous product
customer_reviews.text: Far better value than the standard Polaroid. The film is a better value. One the best features is that you can save photos on memory card and can preview before printing or choose not to print and save image.
customer_reviews.author: Expending mind

customer_reviews.title: Product is below the quality and pay the return shipment.
customer_reviews.text: I have to say this product is below the expectation. and the seller will not pay for the return shipment which is really annoying. Product itself does not works that well than other Instant camera such as Instax Mini 90 Neo.. Plus, it requires square film and the price of square film is double than the normal 2.13" x 3.4" credit card size. Also When I receive the product, the box already is already Opened I have no idea. Now I need to pay the return shipment to get my refund back....
customer_reviews.author: vivianucdi2016

customer_reviews.title: Not charging
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what the deal is with my camera. Turned it on and it said the battery was dead. So I made sure the battery was inserted properly and plugged it in but it’s not charging. I got a red light to show up on the front of the camera a couple times but it goes away after a second. I’ve tried different cable, charging blocks and outlets. No change, is there something I’m doing wrong or do I have a bad battery/charge port?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best polaroid since sliced bread
customer_reviews.text: Not just a camera that prints, but you can see and edit the photos before you print them.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: BEST CAMERA EVER
customer_reviews.text: I always loved the idea of an instant camera. The immediacy means less fuss trying to get that perfect picture. But film is expensive and when you ask someone to take pictures for you, instant camera is hard if the picture isn’t very good because your wasting film. This isn’t the case for this camera. It is a bit more expensive but I feel like I’m saving on film cause every picture is the one I want. Also, I can even transfer photos onto my phone to the SD card.
customer_reviews.author: Ngoc anh le

customer_reviews.title: Love the SD card feature and deciding what to print, but low light is a problem
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera overall. Pros: Digital display, SD card memory to save and print pics later, the option to not auto-print every single photo but decide what Polaroids you want to print. Cons: Low light pictures don't turn out well, even with flash.
customer_reviews.author: jenG

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on it. It's not worth the price. Photo quality is not that great. Plus the square films are super expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Maanasa

customer_reviews.title: Great Polaroid camera
customer_reviews.text: It was perfect gift for my daughter. Loves it and quality was good
customer_reviews.author: Lena Moon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera for my brother, and he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Modern Instant camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! I love the vintage feel of the photos. It really is better than others that you can see the digital photo first so you aren’t wasting film(that isn’t cheap).
customer_reviews.author: Shelby DeFaria

customer_reviews.title: Can't print my existing picture from a different device!
customer_reviews.text: I love it!! It printed some pics from my phone SD before but now for some weird reason, my pictures doesn't show anymore! I can't print my existing photos from my phone
customer_reviews.author: Lucille Dizon

customer_reviews.title: Amazing must have
customer_reviews.text: I’m so happy with this camera! I can not express how much I love it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saves on Film
customer_reviews.text: Christmas present for teen. She appreciates the editing feature and saves on film now.
customer_reviews.author: MelYellow

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I knew I wanted a Polaroid camera but was wary I'd take a bunch of pictures that didn't turn out the way I hoped. This camera fixes that and more! Not only can I see my pictures before I print, I can change the filters, and zoom in after the fact. The best of digital and retro polaroids in one! Pefect marriage.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: Wise purchase, don’t understand things they say about adorama
customer_reviews.text: The price for this camera is very fair, the device is amazing and takes great pictures, I really don’t understand why many people write bad comments about adorama... My camera was purchased from then and it came new and in excellent conditions, ty so much adorama
customer_reviews.author: Luis Guacho

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The product is excellent, good quality, corresponds with the characteristics described by the seller, elegant, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Madrid Cogollo

customer_reviews.title: printed only one so far..
customer_reviews.text: Works well for now, haven't used it much yet. One thing i know so far, photos saved in Paint as JPEG can be recognized by the camera when put on the sd card. Can't really comment on print quality until I make some more prints.
customer_reviews.author: setecientossetentasiete

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: It works as expected. I love that I can reprint pics over and over. Then everyone in the shot gets one to keep.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Yarbrough

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Polaroid
customer_reviews.text: Love the aesthetics of this camera. Love having the ability to take pictures and only print the ones that I like. Saves so much money on film.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia Pagan

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as a true instant camera or a phone printer. The film is still too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: DavidAndIan

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love I can save the pictures on a memory card and decide which ones to print
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Awesome.... Great product... Best value of all the instacks.. I love being ablebto chose which pictures to print
customer_reviews.author: Rufo S. Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Camera was defective. LCD is not functioning. It only shows a white screen. Maybe it’s a good camera. I was just unlucky with the seller, ADORAMA
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Fair price for a really good product ! In perfect conditions! Works well, thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: Taehyungismybias

customer_reviews.title: not what I paid for
customer_reviews.text: I pay for the white camera and I got a the black one.
customer_reviews.author: mileiny

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoy this camera
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this camera. I love the option of viewing it before printing. It is a little on the heavy side & I wish the flash was stronger but other than that I am enjoying it so far. Its very easy to navigate through it & to get use to the buttons too.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: I returned this since it's not a true instant camera ...
customer_reviews.text: I returned this since it's not a true instant camera but rather an instax printer with a low end digital camera attached. It just isn't the same feel on the print. Look forward to other bodies with this square format.
customer_reviews.author: Caislean

customer_reviews.title: Cell phones take better photos, but nice square format!
customer_reviews.text: Great printer and cool square format, but my Galaxy s7 takes much better photos in all situations... You would be better off using this as a photo editor/printer and taking photos with your phone. I wish they would make a square printer or square analogue camera. As of right now, this is just a low quality digital camera with a square format printer. Sure, it's nice that you can print instant black and white/sepia photos without having to buy black and white film, but I feel like you lose the magic of instant film when none of the light from the scene reaches the film and you can make endless copies of the same photo.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

product_meta.title: Fujifilm Instax Square SQ10 Hybrid Instant Camera - Black
product_meta.description: Style:Base| Color:BlackExplore your creative side with the Fujifilm Instax square Sq10 hybrid instant camera. This new Instax instant camera lets you print square photos so your photo creations are even bigger than before. You can add creative filters to your images, brighten or darken your image and add vignettes before you print. Shoot double exposures or long (bulb) exposures and unleash your creative side with the Sq10 instant camera. Fujifilm Instax square Sq10. Creativity squared.
feature_bullets: Prints on new larger square Instax film (2.4” x 2.4”)
Hybrid design lets you preview and edit your image before you print
View your photos and change settings on the large 3” LCD screen
Select your photo and apply any of the 10 fun creative Filters
Save your images to the internal memory or micro SD card then share online
optical zoom: 3.00. Supported image format = JPEG (Some images saved with a photo editing/processing software may not be displayed or printed.)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars227 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
